intro: Cavendishia rigidifolia, commonly known as the rigid-stemmed cavendishia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in humid, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
